Detailed Description

This file contains the Fortran interface routines to PPIDD.

Definition in file ppidd_fortran.c.

fortint *  ilo,
fortint *  ihi,
void *  buff,
void *  fac,
fortlogical *  ok 
)

Accumulate data into a section of a global array.

Atomic operation. global array section (ilo, ihi) += *fac * buffer

  • GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_acc

Broadcast a message from the root process to all other processes.

Collective operation.

  • GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_brdcst
  • MPI2 calls MPI_Bcast

  • type=0 : fortran integer and logical types
  • type=1 : fortran double precision type

Definition at line 680 of file ppidd_fortran.c.

void PPIDD_Create ( char *  name,
fortint *  lentot,
fortint *  datatype,
fortint *  storetype,
fortint *  handle,
fortlogical *  ok 
)

Create an array using the regular distribution model and return integer handle representing the array.

  • datatype=0 : fortran integer and logical types
  • datatype=1 : fortran double precision type
  • storetype=0 : Normal distributed array stored across the distributed processes
  • storetype>=1: Low-latency array stored on one or more helper processes (effective only when helper process is enabled). storetype is advisory: the underlying implementation will use up to storetype helpers.

  • For GA, storetype doesn't take effect, and data are always stored across the distributed processes, analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_create
  • For MPI2, the library can presently be built with zero or one (default) helpers. When helper process is disabled, storetype doesn't take effect, and data are always stored across the distributed processes.

Definition at line 931 of file ppidd_fortran.c.

void PPIDD_Create_irreg ( char *  name,
fortint *  lenin,
fortint *  nchunk,
fortint *  datatype,
fortint *  handle,
fortlogical *  ok 
)

Create an array by following the user-specified distribution and return integer handle representing the array.

Irregular distributed array data are stored across the distributed processes.

  • datatype=0 : fortran integer and logical types
  • datatype=1 : fortran double precision type

  • GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_create_irreg

Definition at line 811 of file ppidd_fortran.c.

void PPIDD_Create_mutexes ( fortint *  storetype,
fortint *  number,
fortlogical *  ok 
)

Create a set of mutex variables that can be used for mutual exclusion.

Returns .true. if the operation succeeded or .false. when failed. It is a collective operation.

  • For GA, storetype doesn't take effect, analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_create_mutexes
  • For MPI2, there are two kinds of mutexes:
    • (1) storetype=0: mutex data will be stored by a global array across the distributed processes. Due to the poor performance of MPI-2 one-sided communication, this kind of mutex is very slow.
    • (2) storetype=1: mutex data will be stored on the helper process. Improve the performance of (1), but still use MPI-2 one-sided communication. It might still be slow when remote process is busy.

When helper process is disabled, storetype doesn't take effect, and mutex data are always stored across the distributed processes.

Definition at line 1636 of file ppidd_fortran.c.

fortlogical *  ok

void PPIDD_Destroy_mutexes ( fortlogical *  ok  ) 

Destroy the set of mutexes created with PPIDD_Create_mutexes.

Returns .true. if the operation succeeded or .false. when failed. This is a collective operation.

  • GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_destroy_mutexes

Definition at line 1713 of file ppidd_fortran.c.

void PPIDD_Distrib ( fortint *  handle,
fortint *  rank,
fortint *  ilo,
fortint *  ihi,
fortlogical *  ok 
)

Return the range of a distributed array held by a specified process.

Return .true. if successful, otherwise .false. If no array elements are owned by the process, the range is returned as [0,-1].

  • GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_distribution

void PPIDD_Error ( char *  message,
fortint *  code 
)

Print an error message and abort the program execution.

  • GA calls GA_Error, http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_error
  • For MPI2, prints error, and then calls MPI_Abort.

Block the calling process until all data transfers complete.

  • MPI2 does nothing

Definition at line 416 of file ppidd_fortran.c.

void PPIDD_Finalize ( void   ) 

Terminate the PPIDD parallel environment.

  • For GA, tidy up global arrays and TCGMSG/MPI, analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_terminate
  • For MPI2, tidy up some associated resources and call MPI_Finalize.

void PPIDD_Gsum ( fortint *  type,
void *  buffer,
fortint *  len,
char *  op 
)

Combine values from all processes and distribute the result back to all processes.

  • GA analogous to GA_dgop and GA_igop, http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_dgop
  • For MPI2, it is realized by MPI_Allreduce

  • type=0 : Fortran Integer
  • type=1 : Fortran Double Precision

Initialize the PPIDD parallel environment.

  • For MPI2, calls MPI_Init.

Definition at line 1527 of file ppidd_fortran.c.

void PPIDD_Inquire_stype ( fortint *  handle,
fortint *  storetype 
)

Returns the storetype of a global array represented by the handle.

storetype: number of helper processes for storing this global array.

  • storetype=0 : Normal distributed array stored across the distributed processes
  • storetype>=1: Low-latency array stored on one or more helper processes (effective only when helper process is enabled).
  • This operation is local.

Definition at line 1592 of file ppidd_fortran.c.

fortint *  source,
fortlogical *  ok 
)

Detect whether a message of the specified type is available.

  • GA (with TCGMSG) analogous to PROBE
  • MPI2 calls MPI_Iprobe

Definition at line 643 of file ppidd_fortran.c.

void PPIDD_Location ( fortint *  handle,
fortint *  ilo,
fortint *  ihi,
fortint *  map,
fortint *  proclist,
fortint *  np,
fortlogical *  ok 
)

Return a list of the processes that hold the data.

Parts of the specified patch might be actually 'owned' by several processes. np is the number of processes hold tha data (return 0 if ilo/ihi are out of bounds "0").

  • GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_locate_region
Parameters:
handle array handle
ilo lower element subscript, 1 (not 0) for fisrt element
ihi higher element subscript
map return start/end index for proclist
proclist proc id list
np proc number
ok return .true. if successful; otherwise .false.

Definition at line 382 of file ppidd_fortran.c.

void PPIDD_Read_inc ( fortint *  ihandle,
fortint *  inum,
fortint *  incr,
fortint *  returnval 
)

Atomically read and increment an element in an integer array.

Reads data from the (inum) element of a global array of integers, returns that value, and increments the (inum) element by a given increment. This is a fetch-and-add operation.

  • GA analogous to http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_read_inc

void PPIDD_Wait ( fortint *  nodesel  ) 

Wait for completion of all asynchronous send/receive.

ignores nodesel !!

  • GA (with TCGMSG) analogous to WAITCOM
  • MPI2 calls MPI_Wait for all asynchronous requests.

Definition at line 616 of file ppidd_fortran.c.

void PPIDD_Wtime ( double *  ctime  ) 

Return an elapsed time on the calling process.

Returns a floating-point number of seconds, representing elapsed wall-clock time since an arbitrary time in the past. The times returned are local to the node that called them. There is no requirement that different nodes return the same time. This is a local operation.

  • GA calls GA_Wtime, which is available only in release 4.1 or greater, http://www.emsl.pnl.gov/docs/global/ga_ops.html#ga_wtime
  • MPI2 calls MPI_Wtime
